|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = 2 |fla1chip = Intel;TE28F800B3BA90; |flash1size = 2 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 4 |ram1chip = EtronTech;EM636165TS-10; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = Davicom;DM9008F; |sw1chip = Kendin;KS8995; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 3 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 00:01:03 |oui = 00:01:03

|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->

|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = Eumitcom WL11000SA-D |rad1modif = Ethernet |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atmel;AT76C510; |rad1chip2 = Intersil;; |rad1chip3 = Intersil;; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = unknown |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== [http://download.modem-help.co.uk/mfcs-U/USR/3CRWE50194/ Downloads on m-h] :The stock OS appears to be '''VxWorks'''.
The old '''[[3Com]]''' logo, "P/N: 143302-401 REV: 01", and "MADE IN TAIWAN R.O.C." is silkscreened on the main board. :The board is using '''Gloira''' (small ones) and '''TAICON''' (big ones) capacitors. This device is using a '''Eumitcom''' WL11000SA-D module (the board used in the [[Eumitcom WA3001A]], AT76C510 based) connected to the main board via the '''[[Kendin]]''' switch.
==Links of Interest== [http://web.archive.org/web/20030515013436/http://www.uninett.no/wlan/product_test/3com-hwg.html Test of the device on uninett.no (via archive.org)] (via [http://www.dslreports.com/forum/r7495026-3Comr-Home-Wireless-Gateway-3CRWE50194-firmware this dslreports forum post]) :OEM is noted as '''AMIT'''
[http://www.practicallynetworked.com/review.asp?pid=292 Reviewed on Practically Networked] (2001-02-21) [http://www.practicallynetworked.com/item.asp?pid=292 Product spec. page on Practially Networked] :10/100 LAN (switched), 10Mbit WAN :WLAN chipset noted as PRISM II
[http://www.manualowl.com/m/3Com/3CRWE50194/Manual/297151 Manual on ManualOwl] :Per the manual, the default SSID is '''101'''.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
